result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory J. Volkening was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Total bond set - $5,000 - Cash bond - $2,500; Sig bond $2,500 TO BE CO-SIGNED BY DEFENDANT'S FATHER AS SURETY

11:57 a.m.  Defendant Cory J. Volkening in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Cory J. Volkening in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf210 and 15cm187.  State files Information. Voorhees in receipt-waives further reading - enters not guilty pleas - requests pre-trial. Voorhees/Schiek statement to modify bail. Court modifies bond to total $5000 bond - $2500-cash $2500 signature co-signed by defendant's father. Continue no contact provision. Adj. 09/18/15  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 02:00 pm. Adj. 12:04 p.m.

3:25 pm. Defendant Cory J. Volkening in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf210 and 15cm187. Detective Brian Zohimsky, RPD, sworn. Direct by Michlig/Court questions witness -Michlig/Voorhees/Court statements to Voorhees hearsay objection - Court rules hearsay is allowed at preliminary hearing  - Witness ID's defendant - Cross by Voorhees. Voorhees moves to dismiss criminal complaint - Voorhees statement to motion - Denied.  Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over - bail continued.  Information to be filed - will contain same charges as complaint. Adj. 3:58 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 11:45 am.

3:06 p.m. Defendant Cory J. Volkening in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm187 and 15cf210. Voorhees requests copies of both criminal complaints.  Waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
Adj. 3:08 p.m.

1:59 p.m. Defendant Cory J. Volkening in court, via video, in custody.  Steven M. Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf210 and 15cm187. Defendant states that he has not contacted pd's office - thought court was next week. Court directs defendant to contact pd's office to see if qualifies - otherwise obtain counsel by next court hearing. Bail modified to include no contact with the Freedenburgs. State will provide copy of complaint.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm. Adj. 2:05 p.m.

3:00 P.M. Defendant Cory J. Volkening in court, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf210 and 15cf187. In 15cf210, in receipt of complaint, right to counsel -  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $5000 cash bond. Intra Circuit transfer to Branch 1.  In 15cm187, Court quashes warrant; reinstates bond. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm. Adj. 3:05 p.m.
